member.name: T:MachinaDynamo.Actions
member.summary: All possible Actions.

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.#ctor
member.summary: Internal constructor

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.Attach(Machina.Tool)
member.summary: Attach a Tool to the flange of the Robot, replacing whichever tool was on it before. Note that the Tool Center Point (TCP) will be translated/rotated according to the tool change.
member.param: A Tool object to attach to the Robot flange

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.Axes(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Increase the axes' rotation angle in degrees at the joints of mechanical devices, specially robotic arms.
member.param: Rotational increment in degrees for Axis 1
Rotational increment in degrees for Axis 2
Rotational increment in degrees for Axis 3
Rotational increment in degrees for Axis 4
Rotational increment in degrees for Axis 5
Rotational increment in degrees for Axis 6

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.AxesTo(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Set the axes' rotation angle in degrees at the joints of mechanical devices, specially robotic arms.
member.param: Angular value in degrees for Axis 1
Angular value in degrees for Axis 2
Angular value in degrees for Axis 3
Angular value in degrees for Axis 4
Angular value in degrees for Axis 5
Angular value in degrees for Axis 6

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.Comment(System.String)
member.summary: Displays an internal comment in a program compilation. This is useful for internal annotations or reminders, but has no effect on the Robot's behavior.
member.param: Comment to be displayed on code compilation

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.Detach
member.summary: Detach any Tool currently attached to the Robot. Note that the Tool Center Point (TCP) will now be transformed to the Robot's flange.

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.Extrude(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Turns extrusion in 3D printers on/off.
member.param: True/false for on/off

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.ExtrusionRate(System.Double)
member.summary: Increases the extrusion rate of filament for 3D printers.
member.param: Increment of mm of filament per mm of movement

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.ExtrusionRateTo(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the extrusion rate of filament for 3D printers.
member.param: Value of mm of filament per mm of movement

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.Message(System.String)
member.summary: Displays a text message on the device. This will depend on the device's configuration, e.g. ABB robots it will display it on the FlexPendant's log window.
member.param: Text message to display

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.MotionMode(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the current motion mode to be applied to future actions. This can be "linear" (default) for straight line movements in euclidean space, or "joint" for smooth interpolation between axes angles. NOTE: "joint" motion may produce unexpected trajectories resulting in reorientations or collisions; use with caution!
member.param: "linear" or "joint"

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.Move(Autodesk.DesignScript.Geometry.Vector)
member.summary: Moves the device along a speficied vector relative to its current position.
member.param: Translation vector

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.MoveTo(Autodesk.DesignScript.Geometry.Point)
member.summary: Moves the device to an absolute location.
member.param: Target Point

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.PopSettings
member.summary: Reverts current settings to the state store by the last call to PushSettings().

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.Precision(System.Double)
member.summary: Increase the precision at which future actions will execute. Precision is measured as the radius of the smooth interpolation between motion targets. This is refered to as "Zone", "Approximate Positioning" or "Blending Radius" in different platforms.
member.param: Radius increment in mm

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.PrecisionTo(System.Double)
member.summary: Set the precision at which future actions will execute. Precision is measured as the radius of the smooth interpolation between motion targets. This is refered to as "Zone", "Approximate Positioning" or "Blending Radius" in different platforms.
member.param: Radius value in mm

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.PushSettings
member.summary: Stores current state settings to a buffer, so that temporary changes can be made, and settings can be reverted to the stored state later with PopSettings().

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.Rotate(Autodesk.DesignScript.Geometry.Vector,System.Double)
member.summary: Rotates the device a specified angle in degrees along the specified vector.
member.param: Rotation axis, with positive rotation direction is defined by the right-hand rule.
Rotation angle in degrees

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.RotateTo(Autodesk.DesignScript.Geometry.Plane)
member.summary: Rotates the device to a specified orientation.
member.param: Target spatial orientation

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.Speed(System.Double)
member.summary: Increases the speed at which future actions will execute.
member.param: Speed increment in mm/s or deg/sec

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.SpeedTo(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the speed at which future actions will execute.
member.param: Speed value in mm/s or deg/sec

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.Temperature(System.Double,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Increment the working temperature of one of the device's parts. Useful for 3D printing operations.
member.param: Temperature increment in °C
Device's part that will change temperature, e.g. "extruder", "bed", etc.
If true, execution will wait for the part to heat up and resume when reached the target.

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.TemperatureTo(System.Double,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set the working temperature of one of the device's parts. Useful for 3D printing operations.
member.param: Temperature value in °C
Device's part that will change temperature, e.g. "extruder", "bed", etc.
If true, execution will wait for the part to heat up and resume when reached the target.

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.Transform(Autodesk.DesignScript.Geometry.Vector,Autodesk.DesignScript.Geometry.Vector,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs a compound relative transformation as a rotation + translation. Note that when performing relative transformations, the R+T versus T+R order matters.
member.param: Translation vector
Rotation axis
Rotation angle in degrees
Apply translation first? Note that when performing relative transformations, the R+T versus T+R order matters.

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.TransformTo(Autodesk.DesignScript.Geometry.Plane)
member.summary: Performs a compound absolute transformation to target Plane. The device's new absolute position and orientation will be those of the Plane.
member.param: Target Plane to transform to

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.Wait(System.Double)
member.summary: Pause program execution for a specified amount of time.
member.param: Pause time in milliseconds

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.WriteAnalog(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Send a value to analog output.
member.param: Analog pin number
Vaue to send to pin

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.WriteDigital(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Activate/deactivate digital output.
member.param: Digital pin number
Turn on?

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.Coordinates(System.String)
member.summary: LET'S PUT A PIN ON THIS ONE... SOME DEEP CHANGES NEED TO HAPPEN AT CORE, SO THIS IS STAYING HERE FOR LEGACY PURPOSES, AND WILL BE REWRITTEN AS SOON AS CORE BRINGS IN A NEW MODEL

Sets the coordinate system that will be used for future relative actions. This can be "global" or "world" (default) to refer to the system's global reference coordinates, or "local" to refer to the device's local reference frame. For example, for a robotic arm, the "global" coordinate system will be the robot's base, and the "local" one will be the coordinates of the tool tip.
member.param: "global" or "local"

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.TurnOff(System.Int32)
member.summary: Turn digital output off. Alias for `WriteDigital(ioNum, false)`

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Actions.TurnOn(System.Int32)
member.summary: Turn digital output on. Alias for `WriteDigital(ioNum, true)`
member.param: Digital pin number

member.name: T:MachinaDynamo.Programs
member.summary: Program creation and visualization options.

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Programs.CompileProgram(Machina.Robot,System.Collections.Generic.List{Machina.Action},System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Compiles a list of Actions into the device's native language. This is the code you would typically need to load into the device's controller to run the program.
member.param: The Robot instance that will export this program
A program in the form of a list of Actions
If true, targets will be declared inline with the instruction. Otherwise, the will be declared and used as independent variables
If true, Machina-style comments with code information will be added to the end of the code instructions

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Programs.DisplayProgram(System.Collections.Generic.List{Machina.Action})
member.summary: Returns a human-readable representation of a list of Actions.
member.param: The list of Actions that conforms a program

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Programs.WriteToFile(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Writes a list of strings to a file. Make sure Dynamo has the adequate Admin rights to write files to your system.
member.param: A List of Strings
The path where the file will be saved

member.summary: Make the constructor internal to hide it from the menu.

member.name: M:MachinaDynamo.Robots.New(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Robot instance.
member.param: A name for this Robot
Input "ABB", "UR", "KUKA", "ZMorph" or "HUMAN" (if you only need a human-readable representation of the actions of this Robot...)
member.returns: Your brand new Machina Robot object

New IO name
Pin number
